summary: The Environmental Protection Agency provides grants to Indian tribes to help protect health and the environment. EPA awarded over $985 million directly to tribes for FY 2014-2019 through 43 grant programs. Tribes use the grants to help prevent air and water pollution, to educate the community about the dangers of radon, and more. title: EPA Grants to Tribes: Additional Actions Needed to Effectively Address Tribal Environmental Concerns
